website_summaries.verdict: Weighted kickboxing gloves designed for women. Adds resistance training with 2 lbs. of weight during training and aerobic practice.
pros: Training gloves designed for strength training
Ideal for adding speed and impact resistance to shadow boxing and kickboxing practice
cons: Strictly for non-contact training and exercise

customer_reviews.title: Don't stay in place - not sure they're really designed for women's hands
customer_reviews.text: These gloves do not stay in place very well - they are too large on my hands. The loop that fits around my pinky is nearly at the end of my finger, not at all close to the knuckle where it would stay in place better. I bought these to add extra weight during HIIT and kickboxing workouts but they're not the best fit and I've used them twice. Still considering returning them due to poor fit.
customer_reviews.author: Rae Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Amount of Weight For Toning While You Work Out
customer_reviews.text: I love running with these gloves. They are adjustable and the added weight is great, without it feeling cumbersome. It actually feels funny to run without them now. They fit perfectly, however I wish there was a better way to wash them. I can imagine a lot of sweat and dirt build up is getting into the sand pockets, so I hope they do not start smelling from bacteria, but so far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna T

customer_reviews.title: I do like them, but if you have tiny hands like ...
customer_reviews.text: I do like them, but if you have tiny hands like me be warned! The wrist strap does tighten up enough for my scrawny wrists, which is nice, but the finger holes are huge. Even with the wrist strap tightened they flop around a lot, and my fingers sometimes slide right out. It makes it awkward to do anything that involves much movement of the arms (I bought them to wear while doing Walk away the pounds DVDs). Oh, and baby powder.. defiantly - these little buggers do not breathe, hands get super sweaty.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Mcbunny

customer_reviews.title: Finger Openings Too Tight
customer_reviews.text: These are nicely made and look cool, but the finger openings are too tight. They may be OK for stationary working out, but NO good for walking unless you have skinny fingers. I end up just attaching the velcro around the wrist and putting my thumb through the thumb hole, but then the weights are just flapping around my hands in an annoying manner. BTW my fingers are normal sized - but while walking your hands are down by your side, so more blood flow enters and if you have tight bands around your fingers, venous flow is interrupted, causing your fingers swell and is uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Doctari

customer_reviews.title: Not the Best Quality!
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased back in November 2018 (I didn't provide a review back then because these things can not be rated immediately since of course you have to fully "test their durability") and it is now July 2019 and they have fallen apart. I used them frequently (3x a week) and I was hoping that they would last a little longer since I like the way they felt in my hands. Plus, now black stuff is coming out from the seams of the glove. So into the garbage they will go and $15 down the drain. I went to the seller's website and of course, no return/exchange information available. Definitely not purchasing from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Alina

customer_reviews.title: Possible scam, false advertising, cheap, meh.
customer_reviews.text: False advertising so be forewarned these are not 1lb each, this might be nitpicky but they are in fact 15.75 oz each glove. I weighed the entire glove. They are also low quality sand filled weights, the kind akin to the cheap 10 dollar Walmart ones you cannot wash. This same kind I've had before which wears and tears easily causing sand to pour everywhere after any kind of daily use. 25 dollars is way overpriced for this garbage I'm returning it since it was meant to be a nice gift. I wish I had read the reviews. Also don't give your information for the "free" things they are supposedly offering on their card.
customer_reviews.author: Paperbackpixie

customer_reviews.title: Weighted Fitness Gloves For Any Workout Routine
customer_reviews.text: I got these to wear while I work out to aerobics, stepping, and walking. They give your arms a really nice workout. They are weighted and I got the black and teal color, which is pretty. I also got these on one of Amazon's "Lightning Deals" which they have all day, every day so I spent even less than the Amazon low price. Great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Wise

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to using a heavier weighted glove and was anxious to receive these. However, after using only a couple times, I noticed the floor had fine black powder on it. I swept it all up and the next day when I used the gloves again, I had the same issue. I swept it all up again, clapped the gloves together a couple times and the black fine dust powder was present again. There were no visible holes or seam issues. I requested a return/refund and the company was very prompt in doing that so I am pleased with their customer service.
customer_reviews.author: KathyandTim

customer_reviews.title: Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: Your hands are going to get sweaty during any workout but they'll be comfortable while you're at it! I don't recommend wearing a watch with a thick band or wearing rings. Only issue is that the weight of the pad causes the glove to slide a little on the back on my hand even though the wrist strap is secured. However, I practice kick boxing with these so it's not that big of a deal!
customer_reviews.author: Stacie

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, I love them
customer_reviews.text: Fabric is soft yet durable, they are easy to take on and off. The weight does work, and it feels good to have them on the back of your hands. The open palm design is also a win, gloves don’t feel sweaty. Finally, because my hands are small, it’s nice that these have a good adjustment range so they do not wiggle. Just excellent. I highly recommend these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Teemaree

customer_reviews.title: They fit well on my small hands and I don't have to worry about them flying off like I do with regular wrist weights
customer_reviews.text: They smell a little bit lit soft hand weights, but that's to be expected because they are weighted gloves. They fit well on my small hands and I don't have to worry about them flying off like I do with regular wrist weights.They are a pound each and that might not seem like much, but you really feel it after a little while.
customer_reviews.author: Banana

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These are great for my zumba class, not too heavy but provide a little extra work out for my arms. They get a little hot but when you're jumping around that is to be expected. If I'm being picky, on the left glove the index finger hole is a little small, but I just leave that finger out, all of the others fit well.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Nice resistance gloves.
customer_reviews.text: 2 pounds per glove filled with sand and iron. They are neoprene gloves so they are a little too stretchy and they make the back back of my hands sweat, which is kind of weird. I broke my left shoulder and am using the weights to get a bit more mobility in the shoulder. Amazing how much four pounds can slow down my neighborhood walks. They are exactly as described.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: These are just what I wanted to add some challenge to my cardio HIIT and weights routine. My hands a bit small (size 6 ring finger) so they’re a bit loose, but the adjustable strap helps. I also appreciate the open palms do I can hold other weights and perform pushups, burpees, planks etc.
customer_reviews.author: stareditor

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Pieces of the weighted sand bag are coming out after only a few days of light use (no contact, just weighted punching). Contacting seller for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel G.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These have done a great job the past couple weeks I have been using them. I have smaller hands so would only say it is more difficult for my hands to fit in the finger holes to hold them on. The wrist strap also can get a tad tight. If leaving it loose, the weight can jiggle around a bit. I have found, if wearing a sweatshirt or wrist band, it is best to put the elastic around this to make it more comfortable. With doing this, these weights have added the perfect resistance to my walks and aerobic workouts!
customer_reviews.author: redskinsgoddess

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable - highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: These are much more comfortable than wrist weights. The wrist weights put all the weight on your wrist and my wrists would actually swell after using them. This puts the weight on the top of your hand and doesn't affect my wrist at all. Very comfortable - will use on walks and while I am doing my stepper and adding arm exercises. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good weights for anyperson
customer_reviews.text: I am a man and I bought these “Empower Woman’s Weighted Gloves”. I have yet to turn into a woman so I guess thats good or not I mean I guess it depends how you look at it Im not judging
customer_reviews.author: Wifflebat Joe

customer_reviews.title: Overall good fit and great for kickboxing!
customer_reviews.text: Fit is pretty good but gave it 4 stars because the finger loops are a little loose so they tend to move a bit when you're hand is not clenched into a fist (the wrist band helps stabilize but it just gets a little annoying). Like the added weight with my kickboxing and MMA workouts, feels like I'm getting a better burn in my arms. I use them for 4 out of my 6 weekly workouts. I do like the open palm design, less sweaty, and having the weight on the back of the hand! Overall I'd recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SJohnson

customer_reviews.title: By far the most comfortable weighted gloves I've tried
customer_reviews.text: Looooove these little gloves. By far the most comfortable weighted gloves I've tried. Do wish they were a little heavier, but they're still great for zumba, aerobics, kickboxing, dancing, etc workouts. They add just enough resistance to burn some extra calories and work out your arms a little more. GET EM. :)
customer_reviews.author: slaughts

customer_reviews.title: Great way to add some resistance!
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended by Andrea Allen. Instagram @deliciouslyfitnhealthy. I used her for personal training and had great success, so I figured I’d try out the gloves she mentioned to me. I love them! I use them for kickboxing and basically any exercise that has my arms moving a lot. They seem really well made. The velcro is sturdy and the weighted portion of them doesn’t flop around while exercising. I almost wish I had some that were heavier, (these are 2lbs), but these offer enough resistance to challenge my arms and shoulders without limiting mobility. They don’t rub/irritate my wrists or hands either during workouts. 10/10 would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Austin and Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I will admit, I have an off-label use for these. I have Essential Tremor and I use these on days where the shaking is really bad. The weight helps me tame it a little bit and be able to do things like pick up cups without spilling my drink everywhere. They work great but are a little heavy for me just doing every day things all day long. For a workout, though, I think the weight would be fine!
customer_reviews.author: buhfly

customer_reviews.title: For Essential Tremor
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would experiment with these for steadying hands effected by essential tremor. I have a similar device that is a half lb weight. But these, at 1 lb, are very effective and a nice change. They allow me to use a mouse, mouse pad, or artist's paintbrush with less shakiness! The palm side is nice and open to hold a device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for Piloxing!!
customer_reviews.text: Great one pound gloves for piloxing. My schedule is all over the place, so my time in the gym is not a regular schedule. Group fitness classes are a great way to break up the weight lifting I do, but I can't always fit the classes in. Piloxing has become my new passion to compliment the weight lifting, and these gloves feel like 10 pound gloves after all of the boxing/Pilates! Love it!!! Great seller!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit
customer_reviews.text: I love these handwrap weights...the only thing I would change is the pinky hole..should be a little tighter. Other than that they are perfect for kickboxing routines. easy to get on and off..did not move around during workout. The extra weight ramped up my workout and was exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Scout

customer_reviews.title: stays put
customer_reviews.text: Really appreciate the look and feel of these gloves. Very important to me was finding a glove that wraps around entire bottom of glove and this fits the bill. In the past I've had gloves that used Velcro only on a portion of the glove that eventually wore out and then scraped on clothing with each arm movement. These won't do that over time due to the longer wrap around.
customer_reviews.author: annmarieb

customer_reviews.title: Not for use with a bag!
customer_reviews.text: If you are doing kickboxing without a bag (ie. doing aerobics), these would be just fine. The weight is nice and would give you a good workout. But, if you are doing real kickboxing where you use a bag for hitting, these will not work at all. They are very large and loose, slipping around your hands. I believe whatever is weighing them would eventually fall out as the fabric is like that of thick yoga pants and will at some point, tear open. They lack the strength and durability required for kickboxing.
customer_reviews.author: smileitfeelsgood

customer_reviews.title: They are perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! I am going to use them for running. I saw some comments talking about the finger holes being too tight and honestly for me they fit and there is actually room. My husband's fingers don't really fit as he tried them on. For me though, they are perfect and I cannot wait to start running with them!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Young

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I decided to order these hand gloves. Came as exactly as described. The finger holds are a little loose for my fingers but not too much that impedes my use of them. The wrist wraps work well. I have really tiny wrists and wear a fitbit and these fit snuggly around my wrists without interfering with the fitbit. Would recommend these. I wear these for Piloxing and Urban Kick.
customer_reviews.author: cathy holler

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried 6 or 7 different brands of 4 pound weighted gloves. For some reason, it’s hard to find 4 lb gloves. I have looked for 3 lb, or more, but have yet to find anything so I use weights in addition to the gloves. Out of what I’ve tried, these are the best. I’ve gotten four or five pairs. They last a long time, but mine start to smell. My workouts are long and intense, and I have an abundance of sweat glands apparently. Great product- I really recommend them. And to the company: can you make a heavier glove?!?!? :)
customer_reviews.author: Allison M. Petroski

customer_reviews.title: Get ready for great arms!
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Don't use them as much as I should, but I really like how they feel and work. I never liked the wrist weights-hard to hold onto and bad for your joints if you're punching with them on. Not to heavy, but the more you do, the more your arms look great. They're also very comfortable, perfect fit. I also put them on upside-down (the weight in my palm) to use as bicep curls and such.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to any routine - gain endurance and add power to your cardio workouts
customer_reviews.text: I have medium-small hands and these gloves fit great. When I first put them they feel too big, but after the workout they feel a bit heavy and not so easy to remove. I let them dry, and I have never washed them. The finger holes are a bit too big when you first put them on, but once done with my floor routine: pushups, burpees, planks, weights and such, I forget they don't fit snug. I like to add them to any routine I have done and got used to in order to gain strength and endurance for my cardio workouts.
customer_reviews.author: SnowflakeL

customer_reviews.title: Velcro gave out after 2 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these exact same weighted gloves that were blue; so I went with them again. The Velcro is already giving out only after 2 months of use and my previous ones lasted me a year. If they're made for "boxing" then the Velcro should be much more durable to withstand the boxing motion. I work out 3-4 times a week and "boxing" only happens randomly. So they weren't extensively used. I'm quite disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: M. Evans

customer_reviews.title: nice gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are good gloves for workouts that use hand weights. I use these for Shawn T's Hip Hop Abs workouts and some other workouts that use weights and they work great. They are adjustable so they should be able to fit just about anyone's hands.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable while running
customer_reviews.text: I use these while running or when I'm on the elliptical machine. They fit nicely and they don't feel bulky. I'm still able to hold on to my iPod comfortably. The reason I gave them a 4 instead of a 5 is because the space for the pointer finger on the left glove is really tight. My fingers are a normal size and the right glove fits perfectly, do I'm assuming it might just be a defect on mine. It isn't worth the time to exchange it, so I just leave that finger out of the loop. The gloves still stay on and feel comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin C.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but beware if you have small hands
customer_reviews.text: Overall I really enjoy the product and it seems it will last. My only qualm with it is that my fingers sometimes slip out as I work out. I'm 5' even and have small hands. I think for someone with regular size hand it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I wanted the weights attached to the gloves. My last pair used velcro and a buckle to keep the weights attached. The weights came loose after awhile. I find these gloves are uncomfortable to wear. The loops around the fingers are tight in spots. Because there is no material in the palm section of the glove I think it puts more strain on the finger loops and they move around a bit when punching. I use them for kickboxing.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mullen

customer_reviews.title: Alright, but I decided I don't like enough to keep using.
customer_reviews.text: These are OK, appear well-made. I was excited to have some that weren't pink-trimmed. I'm used to actual gloves, not the open palm design, which I thought I would like. Turns out my fingernails totally dig into my palms when I'm punching the bag any level above casual. I also thought the finger straps were too fat, so my fingers would start to feel like they were going to go to sleep after squeezing them into fists for a period of time. I thought I would like them, I wish I did. But I gave up trying and had to order a different pair today.
customer_reviews.author: R. Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to treadmill workout
customer_reviews.text: I wear these for the treadmill and love how they don't slip or feel awkward. They are comfortable, not bulky, and the only complaint I have is that after a 1/2 hour workout my hands sweat so wish the fabric was breathable. However, until I need to up the weights these work out (no pun intended) fine!
customer_reviews.author: EllenBee

customer_reviews.title: Amazing gloves
customer_reviews.text: I'm of a very slender build and constantly have trouble keeping bracelets and such on my wrists. The Velcro strap on these weighted gloves keep the gloves in place, and are adjustable for a good fit. The gloves are the perfect weight that you quickly build muscle when working out, and won't hurt your hands or wrists after wearing them for a full work out.
customer_reviews.author: Mira

customer_reviews.title: Better than wrist weights
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I got these instead of standard wrist weights. They're very secure and the open palm design keeps my hands from getting too sweaty. These were a great addition to Jillian Michael's daily rear-kicking of me. My arms were noodles, even with just the extra pound. I had a little bit of a problem with chafing around the top of the finger pieces the first couple of times I wore them but it was easily managed with some tape at first, then when I hand washed the gloves to soften them up a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Countess Chocula

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Gloves fit great. I am small, 5 ft tall. They adjust small enough for me. They stay in place while exercising. They are comfortable and seem to be holding up after about 2 months of use. I definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Mae

customer_reviews.title: Awesome except for one little thing
customer_reviews.text: Really like these, and they work great for the most part. I can't use the first finger hole (pointer finger on my left hand) because it is much smaller than the rest of the finger slots. I didn't want to have to go through the trouble of sending it back, so I have been just skipping that finger slot and using the other three. Other than that they are comfortable, easy to use, and really versatile with the workouts i do. MG
customer_reviews.author: GTS 3

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried these would be clunky or make the workout too hard (I’m doing TurboFire on Beachbody), but I was pleasantly surprised to find out it made my form much better and increased my calorie burn. Really excited to use them more.
customer_reviews.author: Lisak

customer_reviews.title: Great Hand Weights
customer_reviews.text: These are great. They fit well and balance nicely. They only complaint I would have is after a while the finger loops really start hurting. That being said, I use them everyday. They hold up great and really intensify my work out. I would buy again in a heart beat.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Best weighted gloves I have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: The straps on the gloves ensure a nice fit so they don't slip off while I run, the material is durable - even when my lab tried to bite them off, and I washed them and they looked like new again.
customer_reviews.author: Graciousroz

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for weights to add to my walking, I didn't want to have to hold weights the whole time and a lot of the gloves I was seeing were being reviewed as small. These fit great! The palm is open and the actual weight is on the back of the hand. The finger straps are comfortable and not too tight. I am very happy with this purchase and would recommend it to anyone looking to add a little more to their workout.
customer_reviews.author: thevan5

customer_reviews.title: Nice Gloves, Great Fit
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves. They are adjustable with the velcro wrist strap and very convenient to use. Strong Stitching keeps everything in place. Weight is evenly distributed on both gloves. Great set.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Not very happy
customer_reviews.text: I only used them 4 times and then broken. Not good for small hands.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something to help me add weight at the gym because they don’t have 7lbs or 12 lbs. I can’t always jump from a 5lb to a 10lb, or a 10lb to a 15lb. Sometimes you need something in between. They feel well, even though I have small fingers.
customer_reviews.author: monika kelley

customer_reviews.title: Love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: I wear these on my running days. In my mind it helps me be creative while I'm hitting the pavement. I have managed to keep flab off using these. Simple but very effective piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Sheds sand!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves shed sand everywhere! The sand is black therefore if you are wearing shoes you cant tell, but if you are barefoot on the floor, you can feel the sand..it comes out within the stitches...not happy at all..
customer_reviews.author: brenda

customer_reviews.title: Not the weight stated
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these under the impression they would be 2lbs each weight. No they are not, pretty close but not 2lbs These were kept since I had used them before I realized this. However very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Bronte

customer_reviews.title: Well-made fitness gloves with built-in weights
customer_reviews.text: These are great lightweight and well-made fitness gloves in black and teal. They are fitted and remind me of gloves with the fingertips and palms cut out. The fitness gloves have Velcro straps that keep them snug and secure so there is not much movement when walking. My hands are average size. To give you an idea my ring size is 6 or 7. These might fit more snug on a large size hand. They are very comfortable to wear and are perfect for fitness walking on flat trails and sidewalks. These would be great to use for several fitness DVDs such as Turbo Jam or kickboxing.
customer_reviews.author: Andora

customer_reviews.title: Missing contents
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are satisfactory. But the box these came in says it also includes an Illustrated workout guide for Cardio Kickboxing. I have completely taken the box apart and that guide is not included! Also, there should be a download for a FREE Bonus workout. But there is no link to download this. So am feeling gipped since 2 of the 3 items I paid for are missing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schweitzer

customer_reviews.title: Great with VR gear
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves to use with my Oculus Quest (with the BOX VR) game. The gloves don’t get in the way of the controllers at all (because the palms are open) and add further realism (and fitness) to the “boxing” experience.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Weight is perfect for Zumba class. They have fingers and velcro around the wrist, so they stay in place much better than my old ones.
customer_reviews.author: Aka3

customer_reviews.title: Love This Glove!
customer_reviews.text: I use the Empower Weighted Fitness Gloves every day--literally--and I really like them! They're comfortable and well made. I find them much easier that handheld weights. I just slip them on, secure the velcro strap, and forget they're there while getting the benefit of adding weights to my workouts. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Chilly

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and fit well
customer_reviews.text: Revised: From 5 to 4 stars because they ripped. I like the design of these. They fit my medium sized women's hands very well. They also stay securely in place. However, although they appeared sturdy when I first reviewed them, one of them has since ripped. I mended it with heavy-duty upholstery thread, which was a hassle but worth it. The fit of these gloves is still superb, but I seriously hope I won't have to mend them again.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Empower Women's Weighted Fitness Gloves are a perfect fit for me, great cardio boost.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a pair of 2 pound-each men's "gloves" that were more like clumsily wrist bands with this lame thumb hole thing. The Empower Women's Weighted Fitness Gloves are a perfect fit for me, wore them to workout today and they add a lot of extra cardio effect. Seem well made and gave the right amount of extra weight/effort. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Nice Alternative to Dumbbells.
customer_reviews.text: I like using the gloves. When doing combat-type workouts, the weight pad in the glove is not too big. But when walking and I am not gripping the pad; they feel a tad loose. I have big hands, but small wrists. A person with petite hands and wrists may find these a little large.
customer_reviews.author: E. L. Scurry

customer_reviews.title: Maybe not for little hands
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving these 4 stars because I could fit 2 fingers in each of the finger holes. The finger hole fabric is also double layered so its thick. It's a little uncomfortable to punch with a wad of fabric in my fingers. Other than that I like the weight, the wrist strap is crazy adjustable, and the color is nice and bright.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bates

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better if size was smaller
customer_reviews.text: I like them but after a week of wearing them they seem lose on my small hands , I wear sweat band over them to help them stay in place. But really wished I would remove weight to hand wash them; that the down side. They need to have like sm med and lg cuz lots of us have tiny hands.. well I do. Will see how long they last. Will add to post 4 months down the road.
customer_reviews.author: mandie kampsen

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great! There is a slot for every finger and thumb, then a strap to tighten at the base of the hand. This allows total control and stability. The gloves do not slide around during exercise. Because the weights rest on the back of the hand, the palms are free to do pushups, hold a Wii remote, or whatever other exercise modality you prefer. Extremely useful. If only they made 2 or 3 pounds per hand... I would love to have those too!
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to Workouts
customer_reviews.text: Was a little sceppticle, but I absolutely love these gloves. Just the added weight I need for restarting my exercise program and not putting too much pressure on my arms or shoulders. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lang

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves them
customer_reviews.text: My wife has been taking kickboxing classes at our gym and asked me to find her some weighted gloves that she can use for the class and I have to say that she really loves these gloves.They were packaged nicely and came pretty fast. They fit her well and are pretty good quality and were at a great price as well. You know what the ol saying goes.. Happy wife...Happy life!!
customer_reviews.author: Fireice10

customer_reviews.title: Senior Citizens who need a little help!

product_meta.title: Empower Weighted Gloves for Women, Kickboxing, MMA, 2 Lb Set (1 Pound Each Glove), Teal
product_meta.description: Empower Weighted Gloves for Women provide a convenient way to add resistance to your exercise routines while keeping your hands free. Whether you are walking, running, kickboxing, Piloxing, MMA training, or doing Body Combat workouts, this 2-pound set of weighted fitness gloves will enhance your cardio, help you sculpt your arms, shoulders, and upper body, and improve your endurance over time. Unlike traditional dumbbells that you hold in your hands, these weighted gloves for women slip over your fingers and strap around your wrist. Their open-palm design lets your hands breathe and means you can talk on the phone, walk your dog, push your stroller, or hold your water bottle while still getting the benefits of added resistance. Designed for women, Empower weighted gloves are comfortable and versatile. The weight is evenly distributed on the back of your hand and stays put while you exercise. The sand-filled fitness gloves are made from soft, stretchy neoprene and feature reinforced double stitching. Each exercise glove weighs 1 pound and measures 6 by 4 inches (L x W).

COMFORTABLE TO WEAR: Weight is evenly distributed on the back of your hand and stays put while you exercise
MADE TO LAST: Sand-filled weighted gloves made from stretchy neoprene fabric with reinforced double stitching
COMPLETE SET: Includes two 1-pound weighted gloves for women and boxing-inspired workout guide
